background_context.situation: Active member of Santa Barbara Newcomers Club, involved in multiple committees over three years.
background_context.environment: Nonprofit organization with a need for efficient event management and communication.
background_context.constraints: High turnover of committee members every six months, leading to challenges in continuity and knowledge transfer.

goals_motivations.drives: Desire for effective event management and enhanced user experience for all members.
goals_motivations.achievements: Successful coordination of events, ensuring member satisfaction and engagement.

behaviors_patterns.current_work: Regularly logs into the website for event planning and participation.
behaviors_patterns.habits: Uses computer more than mobile app, checks e-news weekly for event updates.

pain_points_frustrations.obstacles: Inadequate training for new committee members, reliance on underpowered mobile app, lack of institutional memory.
pain_points_frustrations.frustrations: Conflicting information between app and website, poor communication around event registrations.

needs_desires.improvements: Better mobile app functionality, streamlined training processes, and improved communication tools.
needs_desires.wants: Formalized systems for knowledge transfer and archives for event management.

attitudes_beliefs.mental_models: Values utility over aesthetics in web design, believes in the importance of clear communication.
attitudes_beliefs.preferences: Prefers clean, simple interfaces that prioritize functionality.

technical_comfort.tools_used: Wild Apricot application, various web applications for committee work.
technical_comfort.technical_abilities: Comfortable with web tools, experienced in managing events but recognizes others may struggle.
technical_comfort.learning_preferences: Prefers hands-on training and clear documentation.

quotes: I was impressed with the Wild Apricot application in terms of what they were doing for nonprofit organizations.
I want to do my business and I want to get out.
The training process really needs to have some hard, hard look at two issues.
Having a paid technical person would be significant.
